Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory751.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noctis', 3: "I give up! This thing ain't working at all!", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Frustrated, Noctis throws his terminal onto the bed and paces back and forth in front of the window.'}
{2: 'It seems we just have no means to contact Babylonia.', 3: '7'}
{3: 'Two of you wasted the whole morning trying to modify the terminal in order to contact Babylonia.'}
{3: 'Still, it looks like you have overestimated your abilities. Compared to professionals like Lee, two amateurs like you can hardly carry out such modifications.'}
{2: "There's no other option. We'll just have to go out there to investigate.", 3: '10'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "What? Didn't that old man tell us not to do it?", 4: '1'}
{2: "We just can't do so in the name of Babylonia.", 3: '13'}
{3: 'If you can still get Daemon through covert investigation, Mayor Max will not have much to say.'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "Are you sure it will work...? But we can't really get anything done in this room. Better get moving then. I'm already bored to death.", 4: '1'}
{2: "Let's split up then.", 3: '16'}
{3: 'Noctis sighs and walks to the door. He tosses his terminal to you.'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: 'Have you forgotten already? You are their primary target. Maybe they have been waiting for you to get out...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "Just stay here and keep in touch. I'll go around the town and investigate.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "I'll find some clues. I swear.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Are you going to be alright on your own?', 3: '23'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "Cut the nonsense. You'll only slow me down.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Noctis has a point, but given his personality, you still deeply suspect whether he can even start a proper conversation with the locals.'}
{3: '—Perhaps you should just start praying that he will not engage in another conflict.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory756.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noctis', 3: 'Hey, mate. Do you know this guy...?', 4: '1'}
{3: "Noctis stops a young man passing by. He takes out Daemon's photo and tries to ask, but the man just rolls his eyes."}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory756.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noctis', 3: 'Hey you, old woman. Have you seen him...?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'He finally finds another elderly woman selling her crops in a shop on the roadside. She seems quite easy-going.'}
{3: "She looks at Noctis' terminal, then stares at him for quite a while before revealing a smile."}
{3: 'With a voice that is way too loud for her age, she pulls the door closed with great force, shutting Noctis—who is still clueless about what just happened—outside.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory756.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Noctis', 3: "****! What's wrong with these people!", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Despite all the negative experiences, Noctis just grumbles and continues on his journey to find the next person who may possibly listen to him.'}
{2: 'Noctis', 3: "I promised to find some clues. No way I'll go back empty-handed... That sucks.", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory757.jpg'}
{3: 'Meanwhile, in a dark corner that Noctis has not noticed, the person he is after already has his eyes on him.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Daemon', 3: "Hah... That idiot's still looking for me. He would never imagine that I'm just right here under his nose.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 3: 'With a smug smile, Daemon pats the shoulder of the person next to him.'}
{2: 'Daemon', 3: "It wouldn't be so smooth without your help, Fann.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Fann', 3: 'I grew up in this town. Nobody knows the people here better than I do. The Babylonia outsiders will have a hard time here...', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Daemon', 3: 'The Forsaken troops will soon pass through here. Since you have helped me, you are our friend. Rest assured that we will keep the locals unbothered.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Fann', 3: "I don't care about the uninvited outsiders. It'll be great if you can drive them both away... But no matter what, I won't let anything harm this town. This is the last thing that can remind me of Mother.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Daemon', 3: "That's easy, but I still don't know about your father... He seems to want this town to remain neutral.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Daemon', 3: 'We warned him many times, but he refuses to give in... He really has no clue who is providing shelter for this town.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Due to their cooperative relationship, the Forsaken camp has been setting up gates to protect New Oakley from Corrupted for years.'}
{2: 'Fann', 3: 'He only clings to those old-fashioned ideals like neutrality and freedom... He must have forgotten how Mother died long ago.', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Daemon looks at Fann with a hint of a smile. To him, those people with resentment cannot be any easier to control.'}
{2: 'Daemon', 3: "As long as things can go smoothly this time, I'll recommend you to Generalissimo. You'll be able to join the Forsaken and seek revenge against Babylonia...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Fann', 3: 'Revenge against Babylonia... Is that really possible?', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Daemon', 3: 'We, the Forsakens, are just like you. Every single one of us hates Babylonia for some reason. After Generalissimo joined us, we have also been secretly accepting the victims of Babylonia.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Daemon', 3: "Soon, we will grow into a formidable power... Those hypocrites in Babylonia won't even be able to imagine what's coming for them.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Daemon points at the faraway tower glowing in blue light. There is a sharp gleam in his eyes.'}
{2: 'Daemon', 3: 'We deserve a place in the area under that light, but Babylonia has taken it all away.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Fann', 3: 'Are the Forsakens going to attack the Clean Zone...?!', 4: '2'}

{2: 'Daemon', 3: 'Correct, and this town acts as a crucial gate near the Clean Zone without the worries about Corrupted interference. As long as you can allow the Forsaken troops to pass, our plan will succeed.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Daemon squints at Noctis, who is still wasting effort on his futile investigation.'}
{2: 'Daemon', 3: 'But right now, these two from Babylonia are our greatest obstacle. It will be a lot of trouble if they discover our plan before it is executed.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Fann', 3: 'Fine. Those scums always disgrace this town, but now would be a good time to make use of them.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Daemon', 3: 'Excellent idea. If the locals here take action, those Babylonia people would probably hold back due to their hypocritical rules.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Fann signals at a few thugs hiding in a shadowy corner.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Strange Resident A', 3: 'Hehe...', 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory751.jpg'}
{3: 'Feeling extremely bored in the room, you cannot figure out what to do. From what you have heard in the terminal, Noctis seems to have no progress either.'}
{3: 'You cannot help but let out a sigh. It seems like an eternity since the last time you felt so powerless. Once again, you realize your limit as a commandant.'}
{3: 'Right then, someone knocks on the door slowly and steadily. You take off the terminal and instinctively reach under the pillow, where the pistol is hidden.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Without waiting for a response, the door is pushed open, and a burly man walks in assuredly, followed by several retinues.'}
{2: 'Mr... Max, what can I do for you?', 3: '108'}
{2: 'Max', 3: 'You are a commandant of Babylonia. A smart person.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Max sits down on a chair, handing his cane to one of his followers.'}
{2: 'I am a commandant, but I may not be that smart.', 3: '111'}
{3: 'He seems not surprised at the absence of Noctis, indicating that he must have picked this time when Noctis is not around.'}
{2: 'Max', 3: "Then I hope your unintelligence won't bring you too much trouble... The rules you are used to do not work here.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Max', 3: "This place is a haven for criminals, thugs, scumbags, and people who couldn't make it anywhere else... These people, well, will not surprise anyone if they suddenly lose their lives the next moment.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Are you trying to get us out of here?', 3: '115'}
{2: 'Max', 3: 'That Construct probably has some reason to stay. But I can tell that you are different...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'He glances at the communicator you were working on just now. The screen still shows a Babylonia message title.'}
{2: 'Max', 3: "You still want to return to Babylonia, don't you?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'That is why he seizes this moment and tries to convince you.'}
{2: "Thanks for the advice, but unfortunately, I'm probably also a criminal now.", 3: '120'}
{3: 'If you fail to find Daemon, you will not be able to explain why you went solo. Your joint operation with Noctis, who was a suspect, can only be interpreted as attempting to defect.'}
{2: 'Max', 3: "Even if you stay here, you won't find anything... Like I said, you are not welcome here. This place is full of...", 4: '1'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{2: '"Criminals, thugs, scums, and people who couldn\'t make it anywhere else," right?', 3: '125'}
{2: 'Then we are just like them now.', 3: '127'}
{3: 'Max seems somewhat surprised. You do not know if it is just a delusion, but his gaze has softened slightly.'}
{2: 'Max', 3: "Hmph... In that case, I won't be able to stop you. You will become the new blood of New Oakley.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Max stands up, takes the cane from the follower, and firmly plants it on the ground with a crisp thud.'}
{2: 'Max', 3: 'Now that you\'ve become a resident of the town, you must, like the others, find a "job" that suits you. Anyone without a job here will be expelled.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'What other job can you possibly handle other than being a commandant...?'}
{3: 'Right then, you hear a loud noise from the communicator in your hand, followed by several screams.'}
{2: 'Noctis?!'}
